title: I moved Android data to SD card and accidently formatted the SD card. SD card was later overwritten. Can my data be retrieved? - Quora

response.answer_text: Formatting refers to a process of preparing a data storage device for initial use, such as a hard disk drive, solid-state drive, USB flash drive, or memory card. During the process, it will be divided into small areas and numbered. And every new disc or disk needs to be formatted before use. If not, your computer will not know where to write and read. Then, you may wonder “How SD card gets formatted?”. It may be a doubt in many users. Some users feel they may accidentally format the SD card, and other users ensure that they don’t delete it. If you don’t delete it by mistake, why your SD card is formatted. Also, your card already is overwritten. Recovering files from SD card after formatting using CMD If you are familiar with the command prompt, you can recover files from a quick formatted SD card via chkdsk.net’s used to check the specified disk for structural corruption. Now, get started with the following steps. Step 1. Connect your SD card to your computer via a card reader. Step 2. Check the drive letter of your SD card via Computer or Disk Management. Step 3. Type cmd in the search box on the start menu, right-click it and run as administrator. Step 4. Type the following command in the command prompt and hit Enter to run it. If the command prompt tells you the volume is in use, you can type Y and press Enter. As your card is already overwritten it is tough to recover your data, but still, there is hope. You can try some great apps. To recover the data from a formatted SD card using Recoverit, follow these simple steps; Step 1: Install Recoverit on to your computer and when the installation is complete, double-click on the program’s icon on the Desktop to launch the program. Once the program is open on your computer, select the formatted SD card. Keep in mind that Recoverit will not recover data from an Android device’s internal memory. You may, therefore, need to connect the Android device to the computer or remove the SD card and insert it into your computer. Click “Start” to begin the process. Step 2: Recoverit will immediately begin scanning the selected USB drive for the missing data. Depending on the size of the files and folders on the drive, the process may take some time, so, you may want to be patient. You can pause or stop the scanning process if you see the file you are looking for. Step 3: Click on a file to preview it and then click “Recover” to save the file to a preferred location on your computer. Recoverit Data Recovery is an ideal solution for the recovery of all types of data from all types of storage devices. If you have any questions regarding this tool or any other data recovery questions, let us know in the comments section below and we’ll do our best to help.

If you are trying to recover from an SD card, I would suggest you download the applexsoft sd card recovery from Mac SD Card Recovery easily recover photos/video/files from SD Cards  Launch the software, and then try a different card reader. If possible, I also suggest you creating an image file of the SD card, then scan and recover from the image file to avoid possible damage of the original data on the card. Please note that we cannot guarantee all the files can be recovered, because there are many possibilities including that data might be fragmented or overwritten, according to the past practices, it is most possible that a file may be destroyed in partial... If you can see the files in the scan results, there is chance to recover them, but I can not guarantee that, because it depends on that if the original data on your disk is still there or destroyed in partial.
